name: Garlic Alfredo Tilapia
author: youngwoman
summary: My version of Ruby Tuesday's New Orleans Seafood, minus the shrimp. I merged a few different recipes and came up with this. It comes pretty close! Three fillets are usually enough for my husband, my toddler, and myself. I serve this with rice and steamed broccoli, to really feel like Ruby Tuesday's recipe!
ingredients: 1 tablespoon Creole seasoning, or to taste
directions: Preheat an oven to 425 degrees F (220 degrees C)
Brush the tilapia fillets with oil on both sides, season with Creole seasoning to taste, then place into a 9x13-inch baking dish
Bake in the preheated oven until the flesh is no longer translucent, and the fish flakes easily with a fork, about 10 minutes
Meanwhile, melt the butter in a small saucepan over medium heat
Stir in the garlic, and cook until the garlic has softened and the aroma has mellowed, about 2 minutes
Stir in the   and bring to a simmer
Reduce the heat to low, and keep warm until the fish is ready
Pour the sauce over the fish to serve
Sprinkle with additional Creole seasoning if desired
